principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Academic Rigor with SaaS Precision
Content is King: Data clarity for Admins, Task focus for Students
Zoom In: Bold metrics and clear code typography
Negative Space: generous padding to reduce cognitive load

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Modal titles

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-sm font-medium px-6 py-2.5 transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-white border border-input hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground shadow-sm font-medium px-6 py-2.5 transition-all active:scale-95

cards.base: bg-white border border-border shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow duration-200
cards.interactive: cursor-pointer hover:border-primary/50 hover:shadow-lg transition-all duration-300 group

inputs.base: h-11 bg-white border-input focus:ring-2 focus:ring-primary/20 focus:border-primary transition-all

login.layout: Split screen: Left side branding/image, Right side form

coding_task.layout: Full height, 3-column: Problem Desc | Code Editor | Output/Tests

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use gradients for text or borders, only subtle backgrounds.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for sticky headers.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles (pill or sharp rounded-md).
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attribute.
instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the ACET platform with a focus on academic integrity and modern usability. Use the provided image URLs for backgrounds. Ensure the 'Anti-Cheat' features (no copy-paste) are visually communicated (e.g., warning toasts). Use Shadcn components for all complex UI elements but style them according to the 'Swiss Tech' theme defined here.
